{"step_by_step_thinking": "At 6 weeks of pregnancy, the most accurate and safe method to diagnose pregnancy would be a method that is non-invasive and provides clear evidence of the pregnancy. Doppler assessment of fetal cardiac activity is usually not used this early in pregnancy. Per vaginal examination of uterine size corresponding to 6 weeks gestation is not the most accurate method as the size of the uterus can vary greatly among women.
